report_title: Power Tool Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Power tool manufacturers make power-driven hand tools as well as spare and replacement parts. Manufacturers have faced ups and downs, primarily because of the pandemic and its aftermath. Power tools are heavily tied to construction activity and residential construction boomed in 2020 amid a low.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Power tools are essential for construction projects because of their efficiency. While hand tools are practical, projects often have strict deadlines, which are easier to meet when using power tools. Unlike hand tools, power tools often need to be replaced, increasing demand. Residential and nonresidential construction represent two critical markets for manufacturers. Amid the pandemic, residential construction was bolstered because of the low housing stock and low-interest rates. This growth has tapered off after an economic recovery and a rise in interest rates.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: HOUSEHOLDS TAKE MATTERS INTO THEIR OWN HANDS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Household consumers have played a vital role for manufacturers. Purchasing power tools for home improvements is more cost-effective than hiring a professional. The pandemic also spurred consumers to take on various do-it-yourself projects. Established companies have better luck appealing to consumers because of brand recognition.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE DETERMINANTAL EFFECT OF LOW-COST IMPORTS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While power tools are helpful and essential for many markets, low-cost imports continue to pose a challenge. Import penetration remains challenging as low-wage countries produce power tools quickly and at much lower costs. Imported power tools make up more than 70.0% of domestic demand, as a strong US dollar makes it easier to purchase foreign goods. Even so, many buyers still prefer domestic power tools and will pay a higher price for brand loyalty and quality.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: LARGE COMPANIES CONTINUE THEIR EXPANSION PROCESS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Volatile prices in raw materials (think steel, iron and plastic) have hindered profitability. Larger companies have increased merger and acquisition activity to mitigate rising production costs and capitalize on synergies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A HEALTHY ECONOMY WILL ENGAGE DOWNSTREAM MARKETS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The effects of the pandemic will subside as the construction markets bounce back. As employees return to the office, property managers hire contractors to touch up office buildings, increasing the need for power tools. Industrial sectors will continue relying on power tools for day-to-day operations. Raw material prices are set to come down from current period highs, allowing manufacturers to generate higher profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: F O R E I G N  T R A D E  R E M A I N S  A  C H A L L E N G E
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Low-cost imports will continue to pose a threat to domestic manufacturers. Even so, the US dollar is set to weaken, modestly slowing import penetration. This also benefits exports, as more countries can afford domestic goods.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: R E S E A R C H  A N D  D E V E L O P M E N T  A R E  T H E  K E Y S  T O  S U C C E S S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While imports may slow down, they still pose a significant threat. Manufacturers are attempting to combat this through product development. Manufacturing products that can improve performance will continue to be vital for success. Customers are more inclined to pay a premium if the tool offers additional benefits (sustainability, time-saving, efficiency, power, adjustability).

industry_definition: This industry manufactures power-driven (e.g. battery, corded, pneumatic) hand tools including drills, circular saws, chain saws and nail guns. Operators that manufacture such tools may also sell spare or replacement parts.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Industrial production index

key_trends: Power tools are essential for construction activities and nearly all contractors use them. Even so, low-cost foreign power tools have flooded the market, constraining domestic manufacturers.
Power tool performance is tied to product innovation. Companies are pouring more money into research and development to ensure their tools stand out amid the rising competition.
Companies must provide their workers with a safe workspace. They are required to follow standards set in place by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).
Low-cost imports pose a significant threat to domestic manufacturers. Tariffs on power tools indirectly ease the level of import penetration.
Battery-powered tools have garnered popularity because of their flexibility and lightweight approach. Innovations to extend battery life will continue to push this product forward.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Both residential and nonresidential construction projects use power tools. Contractors rely on power tools, welding equipment, electronic and semiconductor products. Power tools help contractors complete projects more quickly.

Consumers use power tools for minor repairs, maintenance and do-it-yourself (DIY) projects. While basic hand tools are less expensive, power tools offer more creativity and convenience. Purchasing a power tool can also be considered a long-term investment if the household embarks on multiple projects. DIY projects using professional power tools also help households save money that would otherwise go to a contractor.
Mining, machinery manufacturers and machine shops all use power-driven hand tools. This segment suffered during the pandemic but has quickly bounced back as operations have resumed.

While it is a small segment, some automotive and aviation markets use industrial tools, welding equipment, fluid-power cylinders, pumps, actuators and motors. Similar to other markets, power tools reduce work time while providing better results.

products_and_services.product_description: These tools are typically larger than electric tools and include leaf blowers and chainsaws. While tools in this category can be powered with an electric motor, internal combustion engines are more reliable for larger heavy-duty tools, which require a lot of power. These versatile tools can be used in construction, landscaping and outdoor projects.

Pneumatic, hydraulic and powder-actuated tools are tools powered by air, water and chemical reactants, respectively. In pneumatic tools, compressed air stored in tiny cylinders within the tool is forced through a small internal space to provide power. Hydraulic tools are similar, except they use liquid. Power-actuated tools are powered by small controlled explosions created by chemical propellants. Professional contractors use these tools for nonresidential construction activity.
Electric tools in this segment include sanders, drills, heat guns and jigsaws.

Battery-powered tools include many of the same tools from other product lines, except batteries power them. Some more widely used battery-powered tools include handheld drills and saws. Battery-powered tools are lightweight and less expensive than their counterparts, offering the user more freedom. Innovations in increased battery life and efficiency have bolstered this segment over the years.
This represents miscellaneous tools and parts utilized in the industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PROFESSIONAL CONSTRUCTION MARKETS RELY ON EFFICIENCY
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Both residential and nonresidential construction projects use power tools. Contractors rely on power tools, welding equipment, electronic and semiconductor products. Power tools help contractors complete projects more quickly.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: CONSUMERS ENGAGE IN HOME IMPROVEMENT THEMSELVES
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers use power tools for minor repairs, maintenance and do-it-yourself (DIY) projects. While basic hand tools are less expensive, power tools offer more creativity and convenience. Purchasing a power tool can also be considered a long-term investment if the household embarks on multiple projects. DIY projects using professional power tools also help households save money that would otherwise go to a contractor.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: INDUSTRIAL MARKETS NEED THE PROPER TOOLS TO CARRY OUT OPERATIONS
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Mining, machinery manufacturers and machine shops all use power-driven hand tools. This segment suffered during the pandemic but has quickly bounced back as operations have resumed.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: POWER TOOLS MAKE AUTOMOTIVE AND AVIATION WORK EASIER
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While it is a small segment, some automotive and aviation markets use industrial tools, welding equipment, fluid-power cylinders, pumps, actuators and motors. Similar to other markets, power tools reduce work time while providing better results.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Most imports come from China. Manufacturers use less stringent labor and environmental regulations to produce goods at a fraction of the cost. These savings are passed on to the customers, making the goods inexpensive. Domestic manufacturers must either lower their prices or differentiate their goods as high quality to gain an advantage.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The pandemic only temporarily slowed imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: - Imports took a significant hit in 2020 amid the pandemic as international trade was halted. - As the economy recovered, imports skyrocketed, exceeding pre-pandemic levels. - Imports continue to make up more than 70.0% of domestic demand.
Domestic power tools are sought after because of their quality and precision. While other countries offer low-cost goods, some end markets prefer reputable name brands.

Canada and Mexico are two of the largest exporters because of their shared borders with the US. They have also benefited from the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), allowing free trade between the countries.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes are home to many packaging, welding and automobile manufacturers. It also has many ports that offer easy trade to Canada (the largest export destination).
This region holds numerous manufacturing capabilities and has significant economic influence.
This region is known for its diverse industries and historical significance in manufacturing.
Central US which serves as a hub for various agricultural and manufacturing industries.
A region featuring significant outdoor recreational industries and resources.
More than a quarter of the US population resides in the Southeast, giving manufacturers access to consumer, industrial and construction markets.

The West holds the third-highest number of power manufacturers, most of which are located in California. California is the largest manufacturing state in the country. It also contains significant seaports in San Francisco, Los Angeles and San Diego for trading with Asia.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Regulations and standards vary at the state and local levels. Even so, the Clean Air Act of 1963 and the Clean Water Act of 1972 must be followed by all manufacturers. These laws are constantly updated and amended to keep current with current conditions.

Companies must follow workplace safety laws under OSHA. It requires companies to provide a safe and healthy workspace for workers. Typical requirements include buildings with emergency exits and clearly labeled signs pointing to those exits, automatic fire sprinklers and other fire suppression systems and adequate rest and lunch periods.

factors_decreased_barrier: While some manufacturing processes can be automated, the final process requires skilled workers to ensure products are correctly assembled.

concentration_points.concentration_title: New companies have a lot on their plates and have to compete with recognizable name brands.
concentration_points.concentration_description: New companies have a lot on their plates and have to compete with recognizable name brands. Lowering prices or offering a niche product is one way to gain customers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Import penetration remains a significant threat for manufacturers.
concentration_points.concentration_description: Import penetration remains a significant threat for manufacturers. Low-cost power tools may not provide the same quality as domestic ones, but they are inexpensive for lower-earning consumers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: NAME BRANDS MAKE UP THE MARKET
concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest companies make up over half the market. Companies with recognizable names tend to dominate because of their reputation. Consolidation activity at the top has increased market share.
The remaining manufacturers serve local and regional markets. Many of these companies are at risk of being acquired to help larger players expand their domestic footprint.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are manufacturers' highest expenses, accounting for an estimated 53.9% of revenue in 2023. Costs are lower for power tool manufacturers because power tools are less complex and easily mass-produced. Raw material costs (think steel, iron and plastic) are very volatile and have fluctuated during the period, increasing costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While some manufacturing processes can be automated, the final process requires skilled workers to ensure products are correctly assembled.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic Uncertainty Plays a Significant Role
volatility_points.volatility_description: Power tools are used heavily in the manufacturing and construction sectors. The pandemic halted manufacturing as many factories were shut down temporarily. Non-residential construction also took a hit as business sentiment slumped. Volatile interest rates also affected both the residential and non-residential sectors.
Imports pose a significant threat to manufacturers. The influx of inexpensive goods from China continues to pressure domestic manufacturers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Internal combustion engine-driven tools continue to dominate
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: These tools are typically larger than electric tools and include leaf blowers and chainsaws. While tools in this category can be powered with an electric motor, internal combustion engines are more reliable for larger heavy-duty tools, which require a lot of power. These versatile tools can be used in construction, landscaping and outdoor projects.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Contractors rely on pneumatic, hydraulic and powder-actuated tools
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Pneumatic, hydraulic and powder-actuated tools are tools powered by air, water and chemical reactants, respectively. In pneumatic tools, compressed air stored in tiny cylinders within the tool is forced through a small internal space to provide power. Hydraulic tools are similar, except they use liquid.
Power-actuated tools are powered by small controlled explosions created by chemical propellants. Professional contractors use these tools for nonresidential construction activity.
Electric tools in this segment include sanders, drills, heat guns and jigsaws. Tools accounted for in this segment are not powered by a battery.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Battery-Powered Tools Continue to Garner Popularity
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Battery-powered tools include many of the same tools from other product lines, except batteries power them. Some more widely used battery-powered tools include handheld drills and saws. Battery-powered tools are lightweight and less expensive than their counterparts, offering the user more freedom. Innovations in increased battery life and efficiency have bolstered this segment over the years.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by import penetration from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Import penetration has been the main factor limiting company success.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries like China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: The effect of low-wage countries has caused major shifts for companies. Competition is a main driving force of change in the industry.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Input prices like steel, plastic and battery components influence purchase costs.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Several of the largest manufacturers have stated goals of moving factories abroad.

FAQs.question: What steps does your company take to ensure that it is safeguarding proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Companies make significant efforts to optimize battery placement and efficiency and this requires several safeguards.

FAQs.question: How does your company invest in technology, such as 3D printing, to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: New manufacturing technologies are key for companies seeking to compete on a price basis.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: There has been very limited new regulations place on power tool manufacturers.

FAQs.question: What effect have international tariffs had on your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: There are several tariffs that work to support domestic operators. But they are low enough to allow robust imports.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: The largest companies have been able to maintain higher margins.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Nickel, lead and lithium of key inputs for power tool batteries. As these prices shift it affects selling prices.

FAQs.question: Do you have a reputation for good quality service? Do you manufacture any branded products?
FAQs.answer: This industry contains strong brand names, such as Stanley Black and Decker and Snap-on; therefore, establishing a strong brand name is critical to creating brand recognition and brand loyalty.

FAQs.question: What markets do you target? Is your demand concentrated in any one market? How can you diversify your client base?
FAQs.answer: Having a diverse range of clients provides more stability when economic conditions worsen. If a manufacturer operating within this industry only serves.

FAQs.question: How does your company work to develop new products? In what ways have you innovated your service offerings?
FAQs.answer: Developing and marketing new and innovative products on a consistent basis is a key success factor in that it creates excitement and visibility, which ultimately leads to more sales.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the trade-weighted index? How have fluctuations in the value of the US dollar affected demand for your products?
FAQs.answer: Higher rates dissuade investment in new buildings and structures, which use industry products.

FAQs.question: In which industries do your clients primarily operate? How do you monitor and respond to revenue and profit trends in nonresidential construction?
FAQs.answer: Along with residential construction, this market represents a key component of downstream demand for industry power tools.

FAQs.question: What portion of your sales are derived from the residential construction market? Do you regularly track construction activity?
FAQs.answer: Construction operations involving the building or renovation of residential structures necessitate power tools.
